intro: Rhododendron surugaense, commonly known as the Suruga azalea, is a species native to Japan, specifically the Shizuoka Prefecture. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant produces clusters of pink to red flowers in the spring, which are borne on short pedicels.
